summary:
Since my childhood, I have "grown into" ICT through transport and logistics. Through self-learning, I developed from workplace management to system administration to system development and finally, information analyst. Because I worked at a MBO school, I saw the teacher profession and was immensely attracted to it. In 2009, I graduated cum laude as an Information Engineer (HBO) with certificates in security, auditing, information analysis, application security, programming and business administration, which I later supplemented with a Bachelor of Education (Bed) or second-degree teacher. Managed projects and analising data at Summacollege, now it is my passion to challenge the teachers to find solutions, give occasional hints and then observe the struggle to understand the workings. I can exercise this passion in a wide range of ICT subjects and pedagogy. To be able to continue exercising this passion, I am busy every day with my teaching tasks and self-investigating the latest ICT developments. Self-learning, courses and research on all fronts is also a passion for me. The challenge to not only keep up but also to lead. The nice thing is teaching project settings, developments and organising them with lean, agile or oldfashioned waterfall...
Now I want to take on a new challenge in education myself!
